document.docAuthor: Zhao, Yong-Wei, Zhang, Feng & Jia, Ying
document.docTitle: Stenohya curvata Zhao, Zhang & Jia, 2011, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Stenohya Beier, 1967 (Pseudoscorpiones, Neobisiidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Stenohya Beier, 1967 (Pseudoscorpiones, Neobisiidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male (Ar.-MHBU-YN
100303
), China : Yunnan Province, Dali City, Cangshan Mountain [
25 ° 44 'N
,
100 °05'E
], alt. 2700 m ,
3 March 2010
, Zi-zhong Yang leg. Paratypes : three females, same data as for holotype .

Etymology. The name
curvata
is from the Latin meaning “curved or bent” and refers to the form of the movable chelal finger.

Diagnosis. This new species resembles
S. hamata (
Leclerc & Mahnert, 1988
)
in having a spine on the chelal hand, but it can be distinguished from the latter by: the movable chelal finger curving in basal third (
Fig. 7
), whereas it is straight in
S. hamata
; the spine being situated laterally on the hand in
S. curvata
(
Figs. 4, 7, 8
), as opposed to ventrally in
S. hamata
; and a tubercle present near the spine (
Fig. 7
), which is absent in
S. hamata
.

Description of male ( holotype ).
Colour mostly brown, pedipalps and legs yellow. Setae of body straight and acicular.

Dimensions (length/breadth or depth, in mm). Body length ca. 3.3 . Carapace 1.15 / 0.95 ; diameter of anterior eye 0.10 ; diameter of posterior eye 0.09 . Pedipalps: trochanter 0.78 / 0.37 , femur 1.58 / 0.32 , patella 1.49 / 0.43 , chela (with pedicel) 2.50 / 0.57 , chela (without pedicel) 2.43 , hand length (without pedicel) 1.08 , movable finger length 1.56 . Chelicera 0.68 / 0.30 , movable finger length 0.44 . Leg I: trochanter 0.30 / 0.24 , femur 0.86 / 0.18 , patella 0.60 / 0.18 , tibia 0.73 / 0.12 , basitarsus 0.46 / 0.10 , telotarsus 0.49 / 0.09 . Leg IV: trochanter 0.62 / 0.25 , femur + patella 1.43 / 0.30 , tibia 1.13 / 0.19 , basitarsus 0.55 / 0.12 , telotarsus 0.71 / 0.11 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Stenohya curvata
sp. nov.
, male holotype (1–5, 7–9) and female paratype (6). 1, carapace, dorsal view; 2, carapace, lateral view; 3, coxa of right pedipalp, lateral view, showing several lyrifissures; 4, left pedipalp, dorsal view; 5, right chela, lateral view, showing trichobothriotaxy and teeth; 6, right pedipalp of female, dorsal view, with detail of teeth in lateral view; 7, right chela, ventral view showing curved movable finger and a spine; 8, right chela, dorsal view. Scale bars: 0.5mm (1, 5, 6, 7, 8); 1 mm (2, 4).

FIGURES 9–19.
Stenohya curvata
sp. nov.
, male holotype (9, 10, 12–16, 18) and female paratype (11, 17, 19). 9, right chelicera, dorsal view; 10, galea, male; 11, galea, female; 12, rallum; 13, left leg I; 14, left leg IV; 15, subterminal seta of leg IV; 16 genital operculum, male; 17, genital operculum, female; 18, abdomen, male, ventral view, showing sternites VI–VIII with 6–8 medial discal setae; 19, female sternites VI–VIII with 2 medial discal setae. Scale bars: 0.25 mm (9, 16, 17); 0.05 mm (10–12); 0.5 mm (13, 14, 18, 19).

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs . Leg I: trochanter 1.38–1.40 , femur 4.26–4.58 , patella 3.87–4.06 , tibia 5.08–5.23 , basitarsus 4.20–4.50 , telotarsus 5.33–5.56 times as long as deep. Leg IV: trochanter 2.60 , femur + patella 4.03–4.41 , tibia 6.39–6.68 , basitarsus 4.67–5.45 , telotarsus 6.45 times as long as deep.

Dimensions (length/breadth or depth, in mm). Body length ca. 3.0– 3.1 . Carapace 1.12–1.20 / 0.94–0.97 ; diameter of anterior eye 0.10 ; diameter of posterior eye 0.09 . Pedipalps: trochanter 0.67–0.75 / 0.32–0.38 , femur 1.52–1.60 / 0.29–0.32 , patella 1.30–1.35 / 0.39–0.41 , chela (with pedicel) 2.60–2.62 / 0.60–0.62 , chela (without pedicel) 2.50–2.54 , hand length (without pedicel) 1.15–1.18 , movable finger length 1.48–150 . Chelicera 0.69–0.71 / 0.30–0.33 , movable finger length 0.47–0.49 . Leg I: trochanter 0.33–0.35 / 0.24–0.25 , femur 0.81–0.87 / 0.19 , patella 0.58–0.65 / 0.15–0.16 , tibia 0.66–0.68 / 0.13–0.14 , basitarsus 0.42–0.45 / 0.10–0.11 , telotarsus 0.50–0.52 / 0.09–0.10 . Leg IV: trochanter 0.60–0.65 / 0.22–0.25 , femur + patella 1.41–1.45 / 0.32–0.36 , tibia 1.15–1.27 / 0.18–0.19 , basitarsus 0.56–0.60 / 0.11–0.12 , telotarsus 0.71–0.72 / 0.10–0.11 .
